member.name: M:Winter2022_PassionProject_N01519420.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: M:Winter2022_PassionProject_N01519420.Controllers.ActorController.GetApplicationCookie
member.summary:
Grabs the authentication cookie sent to this controller. For proper WebAPI authentication, you can send a post request with login credentials to the WebAPI and log the access token from the response. The controller already knows this token, so we're just passing it up the chain.
Here is a descriptive article which walks through the process of setting up authorization/authentication directly. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/web-api/overview/security/individual-accounts-in-web-api

members.member:
Receives actor picture data, uploads it to the webserver and updates the actor's HasPic option
the actor id status code 200 if successful.
POST: api/actorData/UpdateactorPic/3 HEADER: enctype=multipart/form-data FORM-DATA: image
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28369529/how-to-set-up-a-web-api-controller-for-multipart-form-data

member.summary: Delete selected actor

the movie id status code 200 if successful.
